definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to show understanding/to excuse/to presume/to expect

sentences.english: Nothing technical content, but also hope that you will be forgiven.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么技术含量，还望高手见谅。

sentences.english: I don't have time for proof-reading, so forgive me if there is any clerical error .
sentences.chinese: 没时间检查拼写了，如有任何书写错误，见谅了。

sentences.english: So, I responded very slowly, please forgive me.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我反应很慢，请见谅。

sentences.english: Sorry for any inconvenience caused, your assistance will be highly appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢您的协助，如造成您的不便，烦请见谅。

sentences.english: I may not be able to reply quickly, if so please forgive me.
sentences.chinese: 我也许不能很快作出回答，如果这样请见谅。

sentences.english: Remove photo directly without further notice, please forgive me.
sentences.chinese: 直接移除照片而不另行通知，敬请见谅。

sentences.english: A good wife always forgives her husbwhen she's wrong. (Milton Berle)
sentences.chinese: 一个好妻子总会在她错了的期间见谅她的丈夫。

sentences.english: Haha, my English is poor, so please forgive me of all overseas Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 哈哈，我的英语水平差，所以请各侨胞们见谅。

sentences.english: We apologize for any inconvenience that may be caused.
sentences.chinese: 对各住户造成不便，敬希见谅。

sentences.english: Please be forgiven if there is any inconveniences occurred.
sentences.chinese: 若有任何不便之处，尽请见谅。

definition: to mock/to be ridiculed/to incur ridicule through one's poor performance (humble)
to let sb down/to be unfair/I'm sorry/pardon me (formal)
to point out mistakes or weak points for correction/to comment/criticism
to calm down/to quell one's anger
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
